definition: yes-man/opinionless person
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
surname Ying
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: He is the boss's favourite because he is a yesman.
sentences.chinese: 他是老板的宠爱，因为他是应声虫。

sentences.english: She has no original opinion; she's just his husband's echo.
sentences.chinese: 她没有主见，只是她丈夫的应声虫。

sentences.english: Because Arnold is a yes-man. He agrees with everything the boss says!
sentences.chinese: 因为他是个应声虫，老板说的话他都附和。

sentences.english: He is an echo of his master.

definition: toady/bootlicker
loudhailer/megaphone/one who parrots sb/mouthpiece
sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
to follow obediently
to bend with the wind
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
blunderer/bungler
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
to be a yes-man
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
pekingese (dog)/(fig.) sycophant/lackey
(derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice
pitiful creature/wretch
